title: The history of the Caribby-islands, viz, Barbados, St Christophers, St Vincents, Martinico, Dominico, Barbouthos, Monserrat, Mevis, Antego, &c in all XXVIII in two books : the first containing the natural, the second, the moral history of those islands : illustrated with several pieces of sculpture representing the most considerable rarities therein described : with a Caribbian vocabulary / rendred into English by John Davies ...
author: Rochefort, César de, b. 1605.
publisher: Printed by J.M. for Thomas Dring and John Starkey, and are to be sold at their shops ...,
notes: "A translation of the anonymous French ed. of 1658"--Sabin.
Attributed to Charles de Rochefort. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.).
"Le vocabulaire caraibe parait être du P. Breton"--Barbier, A.A. Ouvrages anonymes.
Reproduction of original in Newberry Library.
"An account of the Apalachites, the nature of their country, their manners, and their ancient and modern religion": p. 228-249.
